reviewText: Great study of the keystones in history
I really enjoyed learning about Howard Hughes. The documentary is very informative!
Read this version and skip the many others to see the real man, inventor and flyer, forget the other nonsense in a recent movie.
I bought this for a gift for a sick friend. He loves it!

As with any History channel feature, there is too much repetition of the previous scene(s) following the break between scenes (possibly the commercial gap). This detracts from the story line and interrupts the flow of the programme.

Originally designed to avoid ships being attacked by submarines in 1942 this idea was brought to Howard Hughes. He showed signs of OCD by getting involved in every aspect of creation. He was also involved in other activities and then he was in a plane crash. When he recovered the government took him to task for not producing a plane. Eventually he gets one built and takes it for a spin. Insightful, uses actor reenactments and some actual footage of events. Also see The Aviator [HD].
Great Informative and rare footage Video...Loved it! Love Howard Hughes.
Got it when they said it would..... Couldn't believe I found a great gift for my dad, espically since he works on planes & we have seen the spruce goose...Ty so much for selling this n amazon
